intro: Kyllinga urbanii, commonly known as the narrowleaf spurge-kyllinga, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the family Nychthemeralaceae and is characterized by its upright growth habit and small, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces clusters of tiny, greenish-white flowers that are often borne on short pedicels. Kyllinga urbanii is typically found in moist, well-drained soils in wetlands or along stream banks. It is often used in ornamental gardening due to its attractive foliage and ability to thrive in humid conditions.
